i want to copy a file from my computer to a friends using scp, how can i do it?
scp myfile username@friendspc:/some/path/
i tried that, but it came back ssh: cannot connect to host: connection refused
is sshd running on the remote pc
i dont know, how can i tell
is it a Linux box?
yes
sudo netstat -atnp
what should it say
Look for sshd in the last column of the output
nope, there is no sshd anywhere
then you need to start sshd /etc/init.d/sshd start
but you'll possibly need to install it first
ok. When writing the command, do i type friendsusername@his-ip or @his-computer's-name
his-ip will always work, name will only work if you have DNS set up or an entry in your /etc/hosts file
ok, if we both have sshd running it should work right? or is there anything else we have to do first?
only the remote machine needs sshd, provided firewall rules (if you have one between the machines) allow the connection on port 22, that should be all you need
ok, thanks for your help
no problem
/etc/init.d/sshd start
actually that should be "sudo /etc/init.d/ssh start"
